intro: Decamerium, commonly known as the "nine-bark" or "nine-leaf plant," is a unique flowering plant characterized by its distinctive floral structure. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to certain regions of Africa. The plant features a central stem with nine leaves radiating outward, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in shades of white or pink. The botanical interest in decamerium lies in its unusual morphology and potential ecological significance.
